Line 110: Line 110:
===Comparison with Islamism===
===Comparison with Islamism===
  +
{{main|Islamism}}
Salafism differs from the earlier contemporary [[Islam]]ic revival movements of the 1970s and 1980s commonly referred to as [[Islamism]], in that (at least many) Salafis reject not only [[Western culture|Western]] ideologies such as [[Socialism]] and [[Capitalism]], but also common [[Western culture|Western]] concepts like economics, constitutions, political parties and revolution.
Salafism differs from the earlier contemporary [[Islam]]ic revival movements of the 1970s and 1980s commonly referred to as [[Islamism]], in that (at least many) Salafis reject not only [[Western culture|Western]] ideologies such as [[Socialism]] and [[Capitalism]], but also common [[Western culture|Western]] concepts like economics, constitutions, political parties and revolution.
